Package data

Class FileManager

java.lang.Object
data.FileManager
public class FileManager extends Object
This class talks to the overpass API, and processes the data so its can be used by the pathfinding algorithm.

  • Constructor Details

      public FileManager()

  • Method Details

    • getOverpassData

      public void getOverpassData​(Node beginNode, double totalDistance, LoadingDialog dialog, boolean isRandom) throws IOException, InterruptedException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      Sends a query to gather all walkable ways, in a bbox with a radius of total distance from the begin node. After this is done, the data is passed to the parser. It also updates the progressbar while doing this.
      Parameters:
      beginNode - The node for which the ways must be fetched.
      totalDistance - The total required distance of the path.
      dialog - A LoadingDialog to show the progress.
      isRandom - Whether or not to randomise the bbox (which randomises the path)
      Throws:
      IOException - If the html request is invalid somehow.
      InterruptedException - If the html request is interrupted.
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - If the JSON is incorrect.

    • generateBbox

      public String generateBbox​(Node currentNode, double totalDistance, boolean isRandom)
      Generates a bbox, which is required in an overpass request. It generates a bbox of total distance * total distance so even in the worst case scenario (straight way from A to B) enough data is available. This function has an error rate of around 15%, but always overestimates.
      Parameters:
      currentNode - The center node to draw the bbox around.
      totalDistance - The total required distance of the path.
      isRandom - Whether to randomise the size of the bbox (to get different paths).
      Returns:
      A string to be used in further processing.

    • parseJson

      public void parseJson​(org.json.simple.JSONObject jsonObject) throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, IOException
      Adds all nodes to the node set, then attaches the nodes to the corresponding ways, and finally saves the ways.
      Parameters:
      jsonObject - The JSON fetched from overpass.
      Throws:
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - If incorrect JSON is passed.
      IOException - If there's something wrong with the data.

    • generateGpx

      public void generateGpx​(File file, String name, List<Node> points)
      Generates a gpx files based on the parameters.
      Parameters:
      file - The file object to write to.
      name - The name of the path in the gpx file.
      points - The path to base the gpx file on, ordered from start to finish.

    • getNodeSet

      public Set<Node> getNodeSet()
      Returns the nodeset. Returns null if getOverPassData has not been called. this function is only used in testing.
      Returns:
      The nodes gathered from overpass.

    • getWaySet

      public Set<Way> getWaySet()
      Returns the set of ways, fetched from overpass. Returns null if getOverPassData has not been called.
      Returns:
      The ways gathered from overpass.
